intro: Senecio gaspensis, commonly known as the Gaspesia groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small yellow flowers that are surrounded by pale green to white ray florets. Senecio gaspensis is often found in mountainous regions and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
